result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy L Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restituion of $2,973.77 to be paid as a Condtion of Probation as follows:  $304.64 to K.T.; $407.76 to Target (from Case #15CM239); $327.81 to Target c/o Law Office of Michael Asen (from Case #15CM357); $455.76 to Roundy's on North Wales Road (from Case #15CM458); $379.80 to Roundy's on East Moreland Blvd. (from Case #15CM458); $379.80 to Roundy's on Silvernail Road (from Case #15CM458); $379.80 to Roundy's on Capitol Drive (from Case #15CM458); $338.40 to Walmart (from Case #15CM458).

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school after treatment is established.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.
No contact with victim.
No contact with Pick N Save, Target or Walmart Stores.
Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor.

Cases:  #15CF586, #15CM239, #15CM357 and #15CM458 were Dismissed and Read into Case #15CF126.

Court Costs Waived.
DNA Surcharge Waived.
DNA Sample Waived.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  6 Months.  First 60 Days - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.  Last 4 months STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for Compliance for 4 months.

Defendant Tammy L Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.  Cases 15CF586, 15CM239, 15CM357, and 15CM458 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 8 years (Initial Confinement: 4 years, Extended Supervision: 4 years) STAYED.  Credit for 50 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 4 years Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Restitution of $2,973.77 to be paid as a Condition of Probation as follows:  $304.64 to K.T.; $407.76 to Target (from case 15CM239); $327.81 to Target c/o Law Office of Michael Asen (from case 15CM357); $455.76 to Roundy's on N. Wales Rd (from case 15CM458); $379.80 to Roundy's on E. Moreland Blvd (from case 15CM458); $379.80 to Roundy's on Silvernail Rd (from case 15CM458); $379.80 to Roundy's on Capitol Dr. (from case 15CM458); $338.40 to Walmart (from case 15CM458).
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  No contact with victim.  No contact with Pick N Save, Target or Walmart stores.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school after treatment is established.  Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor.
CONDITION TIME: 6 months.  First 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.  Last 4 months STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for Compliance for 4 months.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
